Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.io

Class Printer

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.io.Printer
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultPrinter
public class Printer extends Object
A printer accepts any object as input and converts it to a text representation. Its primary method is print(Object, Writer), which converts the given object to text and writes that text to the given writer. A printer can be configured by associating any Java class with an object printer via the setPrinter(Class, ObjectPrinter) method.

When printing an object, the printer will first try to find the object printer associated with the object's class. If no object printer is defined for that class, it will search for one defined for the object's superclass or any of its interfaces (and so on, recursively). If it still cannot find an object printer, it throws an IllegalArgumentException.

Author:
Stephen G. Ware

  • Method Details

    • getPrinter

      public <T> ObjectPrinter<? super T> getPrinter(Class<T> type)
      Finds the object printer associated with the given Java class, or if there is no association for that class, the object printer associated with the class's superclass or one of its interfaces (and their superclasses and interfaces, and so on).
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the class object
      Parameters:
      type - the class object
      Returns:
      the object printer associated with the class, with its superclass, with one of its interfaces, or null if no object printer is associated with this class or any of its parent types

    • setPrinter

      public <T> void setPrinter(Class<T> type, ObjectPrinter<? super T> printer)
      Associates an object printer with a Java class. The object printer will be used to print objects of this type, or object of types that inherent from this type if no object printer is defined for those subtypes.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the class object
      Parameters:
      type - the class object
      printer - the object printer to associate with the class

    • print

      public <T> void print(T object, Writer writer) throws IOException
      Converts an object to text and writes that text to a writer. The printer will use the object printer associated with the object's class, or its superclass, or one of its interfaces, and so on according to the getPrinter(Class) method.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object being printed
      Parameters:
      object - the object to print
      writer - the writer to which text will be written
      Throws:
      IOException - if an exception occurs while writing text to the writer

    • print

      public <T> void print(T object, File file) throws IOException
      Converts an object to text and writes that text to a file via print(Object, Writer).
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object being printed
      Parameters:
      object - the object to print
      file - the file to which text will be written
      Throws:
      IOException - if an exception occurs while writing text to the file

    • toString

      public String toString(Object object)
      Converts an object to text via print(Object, Writer) and returns that text as a string.
      Parameters:
      object - the object to print
      Returns:
      a string of text representing the object
